alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 21 at 7:07AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 701 AM HST, radar indicated a band of moisture moving up from the south and producing areas of heavy rain over much of the island. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour, and streams across southern and northern Kauai remain elevated from rainfall overnight. Expect continued periods of heavy showers through the morning. - This replaces the Flood Advisory that was covering portions of Kauai. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The entire island of Kauai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1015 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
